content: I've upgraded a drupal 7 to backdrop and realize that some database updates have not being run. How can I force to run the upgrade functions? I guess by changing the schema_version number in system table, but cannot find the right ones. All my figures there are 70xx while in a backdrop install are 10xx.
I see that the upgrade process should create a state table, which is hasn't been created in my upgrade process and running update.php doesn't do it either.
:sweat_smile:

@Robert Garrigos when this happens to me I create a custom module, add an update hook, then manually call the update that has not been run. It's safer than fussing with the schema version column in the system table -- but that works too in a pinch
